headline.main: Thursday Reading: Heart Attack Survivors May Develop P.T.S.D.

docs.abstract: Heart attack survivors may develop P.T.S.D., playing music on a Kindle reader, your parents still don't want to live with you and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.
docs.snippet: Heart attack survivors may develop P.T.S.D., playing music on a Kindle reader, your parents still don't want to live with you and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: 7 P.M. (SNY) THE METS ALL-TIME TEAM Last Sunday, SportsNet New York honored the Mets' 50th anniversary with a tribute to the club's greatest players, past and present (above), in an event at the 92nd Street Y. This program presents highlights from the event, at which an ''all-time team'' was selected by the Mets' play-by-play announcers Gary Cohen and Howie Rose, and the writers Mike Lupica and John Harper of The New York Daily News, Mike Vaccaro of The New York Post and Marty Noble of mlb.com. The team comprises Davey Johnson (manager), Keith Hernandez (first base), Edgardo Alfonzo (second base), José Reyes (shortstop), David Wright (third base), Mike Piazza (catcher), Cleon Jones (left field), Carlos Beltran (center field), Darryl Strawberry (right field) and the pitchers Tom Seaver, Jerry Koosman, Roger McDowell and Tug McGraw. 3 P.M. (FX) ADVENTURELAND (2009) It's the summer of 1987, and James Brennan (Jesse Eisenberg) is dreaming of a post-college trek across Europe, followed by graduate school. But his father has been demoted, so James will have to settle for working at a rundown amusement park. Kristen Stewart plays James's crush, a moody N.Y.U. student secretly involved with a married maintenance man (Ryan Reynolds). Writing in The New York Times about this film from Greg Mottola, A. O. Scott said, ''The smart, slightly depressive vibe feels just right-- for James's era and for our own as well.''

headline.main: Pregnancy Rates Rise for Women Over 40

docs.abstract: What changes in a country where a growing number of women are becoming mothers as others in their cohort become grandmothers?
docs.snippet: What changes in a country where a growing number of women are becoming mothers as others in their cohort become grandmothers?

docs.lead_paragraph: Blood tests can determine paternity as early as the eighth week of pregnancy, and without an invasive procedure.

headline.seo: Paternity Blood Tests That Work Early in a Pregnancy

docs.abstract: Noninvasive prenatal blood tests can determine paternity as early as the eighth or ninth week of pregnancy, easing anxiety of expectant mothers unsure of the father of their baby; test results might also allow women to to terminate the pregnancy if the preferred man is not the father, or seek financial support through the courts.
docs.snippet: Blood tests can determine paternity as early as the eighth week of pregnancy, and without an invasive procedure.

docs.lead_paragraph: A debt sale Tuesday reflects deep market fears about the future of the euro and increases pressure on European leaders to come up with a solution to the crisis.

headline.main: Lingering Fears Push Spanish Short-Term Borrowing Costs Up
headline.print_headline: Borrowing Costs Jump For Spain Once Again

docs.abstract: Spain's cost of borrowing continues to rise to unsustainable levels, reflecting deep fears that the country will eventually need a bailout that Europe might not be able to afford; Spanish treasury has to pay interest of 5.074 percent to attract buyers at an auction of short-term debt, compared to a yield of 2.985 percent only one month earlier, and after Spain's 10-year bond reached its highest interest rate since the creation of the euro.
docs.snippet: A debt sale Tuesday reflects deep market fears about the future of the euro and increases pressure on European leaders to come up with a solution to the crisis.

byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and RAPHAEL MINDER

docs.lead_paragraph: As we learn more about the trillions of microbes we carry around, some scientists want to be like wildlife managers — nurturing the good and weeding out the bad.

headline.seo: Studies of Human Microbiome Yield New Insights

docs.abstract: Emerging doctrine known as 'medical ecology' seeks to promote a more subtle approach to managing the body's trillions of microbes, eschewing the indiscriminate use of antibiotics; proponents received a major boost from the National Human Genome Research Institute's Human Microbiome Project, which sequenced genetic material of bacteria recovered from human beings, revealing some of the ways in which these invisible residents shape human life.
docs.snippet: As we learn more about the trillions of microbes we carry around, some scientists want to be like wildlife managers — nurturing the good and weeding out the bad.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study is testing whether the reproductive hormone progesterone can reduce mortality and long-term disability if administered within hours of the injury.

headline.seo: Study Tests if Progesterone Can Save Lives After Brain Injury
headline.main: A Hormonal Remedy for Brain Injuries Is Explored
headline.print_headline: An Hormonal Remedy for Brain Injuries Is Explored

docs.abstract: Study financed by the National Institutes of Health and overseen by Emory University is testing whether the reproductive hormone progesterone can reduce mortality and long-term disability if administered within hours of a traumatic brain injury.
docs.snippet: A study is testing whether the reproductive hormone progesterone can reduce mortality and long-term disability if administered within hours of the injury.

docs.lead_paragraph: For most of its deliriously odd 75 minutes ''Space//Space,'' a mythic and slyly theatrical production by the experimental company Banana Bag & Bodice, seems like some kind of cosmic joke. It's about brothers in space, bored out of their minds. This trip has the trademarks of dark science fiction, but it's more silly than sinister. The siblings' every move is recorded, but no one is watching. They eat ''emergency sandwiches'' even though the term seems designed to make the meal seem less ordinary. If they meet aliens, what they have to offer from the human race's creations are a couple of greatest-hits albums.
docs.abstract: Jason Zinoman reviews Banana Bag & Bodice production of Jason Craig play Space//Space, directed by Mallory Catlett at Collapsable Hole; Craig stars along with Jessica Jelliffe. Photo (M)
docs.snippet: For most of its deliriously odd 75 minutes ''Space//Space,'' a mythic and slyly theatrical production by the experimental company Banana Bag & Bodice, seems like some kind of cosmic joke. It's about brothers in space, bored out of their minds.     ...

docs.abstract: Those who choose to be childless often have to justify their decision. People who procreate don't. But it should be the other way around.
